Here’s the first half of my discussion on the House floor with @RepTenney about the #Rohingya humanitarian crisis:pic.twitter.com/rT0MQPjYTc
This is Joaquin again – thanks for following our #Rohingya discussion. The international community must act to help end this crisis.pic.twitter.com/rIR9Y6Ai0D
The United States, with regional partners, should also help tackle the underlying issues that led to the violent displacement of #Rohingya.
The international community must assist Bangladesh in providing for the hundreds of thousands of #Rohingya the nation hosts.
As @RepTenney just said, the #Rohingya crisis demands urgent action and is an opportunity for the United States to lead.
I have been disappointed in the lack of moral leadership Aung San Suu Kyi has demonstrated with regard to the #Rohingya crisis.
Foreign assistance helps build the capacity of other nations to govern in a more democratic and inclusive manner.
Humanitarian crises have global consequences, and failure to address them early will eventually affect the United States.
There are similar refugee crises in the Central African Republic, Iraq, South Sudan, Central America, and Yemen.
Many #Rohingya have sought refuge in Bangladesh, Malaysia, Indonesia, Thailand, and India; some have even gone as far as the United States.
The #Rohingya are being driven out of their homes through a systematic campaign of murder, rape, and the destruction of entire communities.
